name: "Falling Up" by Shel Silverstein Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Well it only makes sense to start with the title poem "Falling Up." What happend as a result of "falling up"?
options: I lied up and took a nap
questions.explanation:
I threw down.

	Shel Silverstein's real name was Sheldon Allan Silverstein. He was born in Chicago on September 25. There are two different years given for his birthyear. Some day 1930, others say 1932.

questions.text: What did the "Snowball" do before it ran away?
questions.explanation:
wet the bed.

	Shel Silverstein wrote the music for "The Unicorn Song". He also wrote "Boy Named Sue" and "The Cover of the Rollin' Stone".

questions.text: Fill in the blank from "Little Hoarse". Some things don't mean the way they _________."
questions.explanation:
sound.

	Shel Silverstein wrote "The Giving Tree" a great children's story (though really adults should read it too).

questions.text: In "Turkey?" who was "especially" mad at him for eating the drumstick?
questions.explanation:
the drummer.

	Shel Silverstein died on May 10, 1999 from a heart attack.

questions.text: According to "Long Leg Lou and Short Leg Sue" who had the "Slow-Foot"?
questions.explanation:
Pete.

	Shel Silverstein once said "he was glad that he wasn't familiar with other poets when he began to write, because this helped him find his own style of writing."

questions.text: What is "The Voice" inside of you?
questions.explanation:
conscience.

	In this poem he talks about a voice inside of us that tells us what's right and wrong. In the poem he says that "No teacher, preacher, parent, friend or wise man can decide what's right for you - just listen to the voice that speaks inside."

questions.text: In "Big Eating Contest" how much money did the man spend to win $5.00?
questions.explanation:
$132.

	"$2 entrance fee" "$20 for burgers and fries" "$110 for the hospital bill". Add them up and that totals $132.

questions.text: What kind of rights was Beatrice Bright for in "Warmhearted"?
questions.explanation:
animal.

	"The fox she wears is still alive."

questions.text: Fill in the blank from "We're Out of Paint, So..." "We'll sign our names in __________."
questions.explanation:
applesauce.

	Shel Silverstein also wrote "A Light in the Attic" and "Where the Sidewalk Ends".

questions.text: According to "They Say I Have..." what is "the only thing that is really mine"?
questions.explanation:
behind.

	He got all his body parts from everyone else in his family so at the end he says "Could it be that my behind's the only thing that's mine?"
